tweets.text: Dear @Jacob_Rees_Mogg & @EnvAgencySW. We had to go all the way to a public inquiry, without the support of @bathnes, to stop Mark Foley dumping asbestos in this quarry. So he dumps 100,000 tons of hazardous-waste instead. We warned you. Repeatedly. There must be another inquiry. https://t.co/skkkjIGeT3

@EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 Absolute üí© you'd be punished more harshly for fishing without a licence? ! But it's fine to poison people in their own homes every single day ‚ò†Ô∏è. Red aren't the only ones that stink @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/RDw3IuWUwH

üí®So the wind direction swings around again and the south & west of the Borough get the brunt of the stink this evening. The operator is now halfway to @EnvAgencyMids deadline to reduce the odours without any success. What is the EA‚Äôs plan B? @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/5Ssb90uU4h

@EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 The stench was horrendous yesterday @UHNM_NHS ü§ÆWhich cell was the  waste was put in yesterday?ü§îWhen will the ‚Äògas‚Äô collection system be working? Timescales for the results of the discharge into the brook? It‚Äôs continued misery for the many. @StinkStopthe #stopthestink

@AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg  How long can @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA  Ignore us? These are surely record breaking numbers! 5899 complaints for the month of March. #wecantbreath
#capitoff #stopthestink https://t.co/ZJ4qKzgHK2

tweets.text: Superb to see this corner of @unitedutilities Bowland Estate getting wetter and boggier with the help of @PenninePeatLIFE Project - even if does make for tougher running conditions! You can see the hydrology of the site beginning to be restored and the bare peat revegetated üòÅüëçüèª https://t.co/umpLqWjU7f
@lucyb221 @LoneRanger77777 @RedIndustries2 @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg It‚Äôs so depressing, our house is the same this morning, it‚Äôs awful.

I can hand on my heart say I have never woken up crying because I‚Äôm been GASSED in my own bedroom, until now. I can‚Äôt put into words how bad the smell is this morning, thanks so much @RedIndustries2 üñïüèΩ#stopthestink @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg

urls.title: The River Lea is plagued by pollution ‚Äì it is no place for a swim | Letters
urls.description: Letters: Readers respond to a photo essay on bathers in the River Lea at Hackney Marshes in east London

tweets.text:
"We do know that local volunteers are pulling sanitary waste out of the river just upstream of 'Hackney Beach'." The reality of England's rivers.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/rdKF8KpJFu

Hi @RachSalv, can you help us? We're a community plagued by noxious gasses coming from a poorly run landfill that is far to close to houses. Easily the most complained about site in the UK and the @EnvAgencyMids failed us for years. Can you help?
@SianieRoo @poppers82 @PHE_EoEngland @EnvAgency Horrendous, shouldn't have to live like this, homes turned Into toxic tombs night after night, been bad all day  today.

Good lord.The landfill gas is eye watering in the Westlands,seeped into the house gassing my 3 year old in his bed as we speak& I‚Äôm inhaling it in my living room(doors&windows closed).Sore throat with prickling sensation,asthmatic chest tightening @PHE_EoEngland @EnvAgency

urls.title: Man jailed after 100,000 tons of hazardous waste dumped near reservoir
urls.description: It is potentially polluting the ground close to the biggest source of drinking water for the city - and could cost up to ¬£9 billion to clean up

tweets.text: There is something very wrong in the way the environment agency is resourced & practices if you have to wait until 100,000 tons of hazardous waste are dumped close to a huge reservoir, despite repeated whistleblowing from residents, before action is taken. https://t.co/S2ygY1JY5Q
